intro: Acetosella mundii, commonly known as the common sorrel, is a low-growing herbaceous plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which are typically heart-shaped and have a sour taste due to the presence of oxalic acid. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Acetosella mundii is a perennial species that is widely distributed across Europe and parts of Asia.
